meanings.definition: To grant or give something as a favor or privilege.
meanings.sent1: She vouchsafed her time to help the new student with their project.
meanings.sent2: The king vouchsafed the title of knight to the brave warrior.
meanings.sent3: The teacher vouchsafed extra recess time as a reward for good behavior.
meanings.sent4: The sun vouchsafed its warm rays to the flowers, helping them grow.
meanings.sent5: The kind neighbor vouchsafed a cup of sugar to the young baker in need.

meanings.definition: To condescend or deign to give something.
meanings.sent1: He vouchsafed a smile to the shy child, making them feel welcome.
meanings.sent2: The celebrity vouchsafed a moment of their time to take a photo with a fan.
meanings.sent3: The cat vouchsafed a purr to show its contentment with the warm blanket.
meanings.sent4: The tree vouchsafed its shade to the tired traveler, offering a place to rest.
meanings.sent5: The boss vouchsafed a nod of approval to the hardworking employee.
